customer_name: JOHN GRABER MARIE GRABER LEWIS GRABER

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During todays inspection a female Golden Retriever "Nicole" was noticed to have a heavy accumulation of crusty
black/brown dry matter adhered to the hair on the top of her head. In addition, the skin underneath appears dull and
flakey in several areas. The facility did identify this issue about a week ago, but has not started any treatment for the
current skin issue. In addition; this facility does not currently have guidance provided in their program of veterinary care
and has not communicated with their veterinarian on the proper course of treatment for this dog. Heath issues that are left
untreated can cause pain and discomfort to the animals. The Licensee must have a a mechanism of direct and frequent
communication so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is
conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Correct By: 12/25/2020
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During todays inspection a female Golden Retriever  "Nicole" was noticed to have a heavy accumulation of crusty 
black/brown dry matter adhered to the hair on the top of her head.  In addition, the skin underneath appears dull and 
flakey in several areas.  The facility did identify this issue about a week ago, but has not started any treatment for the 
current skin issue.  In addition; this facility does not currently have guidance provided  in their program of veterinary care 
and has not communicated with their veterinarian  on the proper course of treatment for this dog. Heath issues that are left 
untreated can cause pain and discomfort to the animals.  The Licensee must have a a mechanism of direct and frequent 
communication so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior,  and well-being is 
conveyed to the attending veterinarian. 
Correct By: 12/25/2020 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives. 
 
End Section
